text: RT @EnvAgencyYNE: Yorkshire update: Despite river levels currently falling we still have 8 flood warnings and 7 flood alerts in place acros…

@agricontract @EnvAgency Agree sick of flooding but your diagrams are misleading. On clay and silty clay loams for example the top soil layer seals and sheds water quickly without percolating to lower levels. Silt may sit in low lying rivers but not upland ones etc need rivers to reconnect flood plains

text: @Rosewood_Farm @MFRFurness @TM_WRT @agricontract @JamesAgscope @EnvAgency @JanetHughes They are only as good as they’re weakest point. As always balance is all, with a balanced approach waterways can be fantastic habitats and functional drainage channels.

Now a lot of waterways are fantastic habitats but inefficient waterways 1/2

@SpudSlingsby @cutlerstom @powell_peter @NrtSam @hslyfarms @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Above my ground would be nice 😀 - I meant above the point at where you're draining but yeah, it is expensive to build them at the coast. It leaves me in awe how much expense and effort it took to create our floodbanks.

@hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @cutlerstom @NrtSam @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency The other thing,  (which I always forget coming from Wales). Is the huge difference between river catchments. Dredging is necessary on the fens or Holland to get water to move at all. Definitely not the case on say the Conwy, where the water moves very fast all in its own.
Well the Government has only had 30 years to give the @EnvAgency adequate powers. Then, they could start giving it adequate resources. https://t.co/hOTyezODKa

text: RT @TimGue1: It’s that simple @EnvAgency

@MFRFurness @agricontract @EnvAgency What a load of 💩 @EnvAgency, ‘vision, adaptation and resilience’!!🤣🤦‍♂️. Dredge the rivers, do what you should be doing.  Take a leaf out of the IDB’s in The Fens, they know what they’re doing.  Obviously none of the EA executives live alongside a flooding river.

@cutlerstom @NrtSam @hslyfarms @Rosewood_Farm @billmero @agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Surface water flooding is inevitable during heavy storms. We need to plan which areas will flood and put in the correct infrastructure and compensation to build resilience. Storage only needs to be for a few extra days to reduce damaging peaks downstream.
